website_summaries.verdict: Folds down to nothing and cooks with minimal charcoal, making this an ideal camping BBQ for two.
pros: Small charcoal BBQ folds down for camping, travel and more
cons: Small size makes this grill ideal for two people and no more

customer_reviews.title: Compact and just had yummy BBQ!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy something small and compact. I had to be something stored indoors since I have a small condo. Love the bag and I see myself taking it a picnic or to the beach. The only thing I have a small complaint about are the edges which are very sharp. Just be careful when handling. Otherwise, perfect little grill! As soon as it arrived, we BBQ'd immediately!
customer_reviews.author: TripleAM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect camping grill for two.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in May. We love camping and travel by motorcycle with a small trailer behind us for all our gear. It is a great little grill. Perfect for the two of us. Folds down to a very small size. Easy to clean and uses very little charcoal. We just wish it had one more rack in the bottom to lay the charcoal on. It does need a little more air to circulate underneath the charcoal for quicker lighting. We just use the little Weber "pills" to get the charcoal going. Foil lining the bottom of the grill helps greatly with clean up, just be sure not to cover the holes on the sides.
customer_reviews.author: itsme

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice But Be Careful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grill to carry in my class B motorhome because storage space is at such a premium. It appears to be exactly what I was looking for. But be careful, many of the edges are extremely sharp. I used a file to round them off to be safe. I've not used the grill yet but I'm anxious to try it.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Most excellent !
customer_reviews.text: This is Exactly what I wanted. Small enough to qualify as being portable and still big enough to cook a Whole 4 pound chicken, Or, a Whole Tri-Tip Roast. And, this is a charcoal grill...."real BBQ ing" ! Take the "base" and use it for a cover. Make a small "wind cover" like the one that is included, and you can completely "Shut down" after your food is done. Then, you can most likely "re-use" the remaining charcoal brickettes. It took approx. 15 pieces of charcoal to cook a 4 pound chicken, and there's enough remaining to cook 4 burgers or hot dogs. This is a little expensive but still well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Henry

customer_reviews.title: nice stove and compact
customer_reviews.text: Not going to write a lot about this stove. I like it it's easy to use and functions as advertised. The only thing I do not like are the sharp edges on the metal.

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend buying this grill
customer_reviews.text: This grill began to twist out of shape upon the first time using it. I do not recommend buying this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Portable Grill
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed and folds very compact for storage. Since it is February I haven't had the opportunity yet to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Butch

customer_reviews.title: Good concept
customer_reviews.text: I own the tiny Esbit pocket stove and like it for camping and emergency scenarios. This grill is essentially the same concept, but obviously much bigger. I like that concept, but the grill should be made of thicker metal sheets. Yeah, I get that doing so would add to the weight, but at least it won't always feel like it will cut my fingers. Also, be careful when opening/closing the grill. This is probably the most portable grill that I have come across. It won't be my main grill, and I doubt it was designed to be anyone's main grill.
customer_reviews.author: M&M&M&M

customer_reviews.title: great for
customer_reviews.text: small, compact, and seems to work well, great for camping
customer_reviews.author: jeremy waters

customer_reviews.title: My goto grill when on the go
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to setup and take down grill. It's just the right size to feed 2-3 people easily. It's compact enough to haul around in a backpack for beachbag. It's stainless so no corrosion to deal with. Does steaks with aplomb. Chicken thighs and or wings are no sweat. If you can locate this here on Amazon get it . These things come in 2 versions this is the larger of the two and are very hard to find. Buy it if you find it. Can't go wrong you'll enjoy it for years of beachgoing or hiking. or just a easy impromptu grill craving fix.
customer_reviews.author: KAKELE

product_meta.title: Esbit Portable Folding Charcoal BBQ Grill with Carrying Bag
product_meta.description: The Esbit Foldable BBQ-Box is a compact and durable BBQ that is stainless steel construction. The stove folds down to 12" X 9 X 3.5 and weighs only 5lbs 4ozs. It comes with a nylon carrier bag that has a convienient shoulder strap. The grill has threee level, height-adjustable grate with removable handle. It can use charcoal or wood for grilling and one portion of charcoal can be stored inside the packed grill for easy transport.
feature_bullets: Can use charcoal or wood for grilling
